Package sample.shapes

Class ShapeProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.shapes.ShapeProvider

  • public class ShapeProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    This singleton Class creates all shapes used and manages all the change of position of those shapes.

      • circumcircle

        public final javafx.scene.shape.Circle circumcircle
        The circumcircle is a triangle's circumscribed circle, i.e., the unique circle that passes through each of the triangle's three vertices.

      • circumcenter

        public final CircleCenter circumcenter
        The circumcenter is the center of a triangle's circumcircle. It can be found as the intersection of the perpendicular bisectors.

        details

      • centroid

        public final CircleCenter centroid
        The geometric centroid (center of mass) of the polygon vertices of a triangle is the point G (sometimes also denoted M) which is also the intersection of the triangle's three triangle medians. The point is therefore sometimes called the median point. The centroid is always in the interior of the triangle.

        details

      • orth1

        public final javafx.scene.shape.Line orth1
        One of the triangle altitude. Connect perpendicularly one of the TriangleVertex to of it's opposing edge.

      • orth2

        public final javafx.scene.shape.Line orth2
        One of the triangle altitude. Connect perpendicularly one of the TriangleVertex to of it's opposing edge.

      • orth3

        public final javafx.scene.shape.Line orth3
        One of the triangle altitude. Connect perpendicularly one of the TriangleVertex to of it's opposing edge.

      • orthocenter

        public final CircleCenter orthocenter
        The three (possibly extended) altitudes intersect in a single point, called the orthocenter of the triangle, usually denoted by H.[1][2] The orthocenter lies inside the triangle if and only if the triangle is acute (i.e. does not have an angle greater than or equal to a right angle). If one angle is a right angle, the orthocenter coincides with the vertex at the right angle.

        details

      • eulerLine

        public final javafx.scene.shape.Line eulerLine
        is a line determined from any triangle that is not equilateral. It is a central line of the triangle, and it passes through several important points determined from the triangle, including the orthocenter, the circumcenter and the centroid of the triangle.

      • inCircle

        public final javafx.scene.shape.Circle inCircle
        A circle for which each of the triangle edges are tangeant to.

      • incenter

        public final CircleCenter incenter
        The incenter may be equivalently defined as the point where the internal angle bisectors of the triangle cross, as the point equidistant from the triangle's sides, as the junction point of the medial axis and innermost point of the grassfire transform of the triangle, and as the center point of the inscribed circle of the triangle.

        details

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ShapeProvider getInstance​()
        Thread safe singleton getter for the instance of the class.
        Returns:
        the unique instace of this class.

      • updateShapes

        public void updateShapes​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                         TriangleVertex point)
        Updates every Shape part of the ShapeProvider in response to a MouseEvent moving one of the TriangleVertex. Every position of every shape is recalculated using the new position of the currently dragged TriangleVertex.
        Parameters:
        event - the MouseEvent that is created as part of a EventHandler. Called during the Node.setOnMouseDragged(EventHandler) of the TriangleVertex.
        point - The TriangleVertex the is currently beign dragged.

      • updateShapesOnCenterClick

        public void updateShapesOnCenterClick​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                                      CircleCenter centerOnFocus)
        Updates every Shape part of the ShapeProvider in response to a MouseEvent moving one of the CircleCenter. Every position of every shape is recalculated using the new position of the currently dragged CircleCenter.
        Parameters:
        event - the MouseEvent that is created as part of a EventHandler. Called during the Node.setOnMouseDragged(EventHandler) of the CircleCenter.
        centerOnFocus - The CircleCenter the is currently beign dragged.

      • updateLinesFromPoint

        public void updateLinesFromPoint​()
        Updates all the lines (centerLine1, centerLine2, centerLine3, bisector1, bisector2, bisector3, orth1, orth2, orth3 and eulerLine. Must also recalculated and update orth1.

      • updateEverythingFromPoints

        public void updateEverythingFromPoints​()
        Resets and recalculates the position of every shape of the triangle base one the position of the three TriangleVertex p1m p2 and p3.
